DOC.detailed_description: This pilot project propose evaluate feasibility , acceptability , efficacy mobile intervention target smoking-cessation physical activity among low-income person . The intervention , name Smoking Treatment Exercise Program Underserved Populations ( STEP UP ) , combine smartphone-based contingency-management application ( app ) , provide monetary reinforcement smoke abstinence physical activity , 5 week telephone-based cognitive-behavioral therapy ( CBT ) prevent relapse , nicotine replacement pharmacotherapy , text-messaging support physical-activity goal . Participants give smartphone , compact carbon-monoxide ( CO ) monitor , recency smoking determine , Garmin Vivosmart wristband step-tracker . Twice day semi-random interval , participant prompt app submit video blow CO monitor . Monetary reinforcement immediately provide contingent upon below-threshold CO reading . The app also continuously syncs Garmin step-tracker , provide supportive message bonus incentivesâ€”namely double reinforcement smoking abstinence among participant meet personalized daily step goal . The expected outcome project provide information evaluate efficacy innovative approach preparation subsequent large clinical trial build upon capability mHealth technology reduce prevalence smoking among low income smoker .
